greyshed.lib

Class Pose

  • java.lang.Object
    • greyshed.lib.Pose

  • public class Pose
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple class to store, define and modify a "pose" (also known as a frame, target, or plane). A Pose composed of position data "pos" (PVector) and orientation data "orient" (Quaternion)

    Pose is the format for defining target planes for ABB robots. (An ABB "robTarget", without configuration or exeternal axis data).

    Options for returning alternative representations of orientations are included in the quaternion class, including axis angles (UR robots) and PMatrix formats.

    +Example
    import greyshed.lib.*; //import the library

ShapeMethods sm;

PVector pt = new PVector(20,20);
PVector center;

void setup() {
  size(200,200);
  sm = new ShapeMethods(this);
  center = new PVector(width/2,height/2);
}

void draw() {
  background(0);
  PVector rotatedPt = sm.rotatePoint(pt, center, PI);
  strokeWeight(10);
  stroke(255,0,0);
  point(rotatedPt.x,rotatedPt.y);
}

      • fromPoints

        public void fromPoints(PVector origin,
                       PVector xPt,
                       PVector yPt)
        Sets a pose/plane from three points. The equavalent to "plane from 3 points" in Rhino/Grasshopper.
        Parameters:
        origin - the origin of the pose
        xPt - a point on the x axis of the desired plane
        yPt - a point on the y axis of the desired plane

      • fromTargetAndGuide

        public void fromTargetAndGuide(PVector target,
                               PVector zDir)
        Sets a pose/plane from the plane origin and a vector representing the z-axis of the desired plane (plane normal). The plane is rotationally aligned as close as possible to the world x axis.
        Parameters:
        target - the origin of the pose/plane
        zDir - the normal direction of the plane/pose

      • fromTargetAndGuide

        public void fromTargetAndGuide(PVector target,
                               PVector zDir,
                               PVector xGuide)
        Sets a pose/plane from the plane origin and a vector representing the z-axis of the desired plane (plane normal). The rotation of the plane is set by the third vector, which represents the desired x axis of the plane.
        Parameters:
        target - the origin of the pose/plane
        zDir - the normal direction of the plane/pose
        xGuide - the x guide vector for aligning the rotation of the plane about the designated z axis

      • transformPoint

        public PVector transformPoint(PVector p1)
        Using the Pose of a plane in the world/workobject coordinate system (i.e. the pose of the origin of the kinect in the world system) and given a point in the coordinate system of a plane (i.e. a kinect point) and using the Pose the Pose of that plane in the world/wobj coordinate system, return the location of that point in the world/wobj coordinate system

        This function is especially useful if the kinect is mounted to the robot and the tooldata of the robot has been calibrated at the kinect's origin. Or, if the kinect is at a fixed point in space, and it's origin has been calculated as a pose in world or workobject coords. Basically, it tranforms a point in kinect coordinate space to robot coordinate space

        Ensure that your incoming points are right hand rule, i.e. not mirrored across the x axis...

        information and code on rotations with quaternions can be found here: http://www.euclideanspace.com/maths/algebra/realNormedAlgebra/quaternions/transforms/ the origin of the pose/plane

        Parameters:
        thePt - the point to transform
